body:
**What happened**:
When sending a request to the server side apply endpoint (`-XPATCH -H"Content-Type: application/apply-patch+yaml"`), if the apiVersion provided in the object is different from the apiVersion in the url, it returns a 500 error, like:
```
"status": "Failure",
"message": "failed to merge config: expected objects of the same type, but got {...} and {...}",
"code": 500
```

**What you expected to happen**:
The request should fail if the apiVersion provided in the object is different from the apiVersion in the url, but it should fail before trying to merge, and be a 4xx error. Probably a bad request error.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
The check should probably be done somewhere near this [TODO comment](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/d73dbfc8c1bdc443cf6bf2f70a7789b689815cf7/staging/src/k8s.io/apiserver/pkg/endpoints/handlers/fieldmanager/fieldmanager.go#L154-L156). The issue, though, is that the patch is given as a byte array, and needs to be deserialized into an object to access the apiVersion field.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
With a kube-apiserver built from head, running with `--feature-gates=ServerSideApply=true`:
```
curl -XPATCH -H"Content-Type: application/apply-patch+yaml" -d"{\"apiVersion\":\"extensions/v1beta1\",\"kind\":\"Deployment\",\"metadata\":{\"name\":\"test\"},\"spec\":{\"selector\":{\"matchLabels\":{\"app\":\"foo\"}},\"template\":{\"metadata\":{\"labels\":{\"app\":\"foo\"}},\"spec\":{\"containers\":[{\"name\":\"c\",\"image\":\"i\"}]}}}}" 127.0.0.1:8080/apis/apps/v1/namespaces/default/deployments/test?force=false && echo
```
